tool.name: Generate ISCC hash
tool.command: #if $input_type.input_selector == "single": ## Single file mode iscc-sum '${input_type.input_file}' | cut -d':' -f2 | cut -d' ' -f1 > '${output_file}' #else: ## Calculate single ISCC hash for all files together cat #for $input in $input_type.input_collection: '$input' #end for | iscc-sum - | cut -d':' -f2 | cut -d' ' -f1 > '${output_file}' #end if

param.name: input_file
param.label: Input File
param.help: Data set or collection - each file will be processed separately

param.name: input_collection
param.label: Input File Collection
param.help: A collection of files - ISCC-SUM will generate checksum and similarity hash across the collection

tool.help:
What it does ============
Generates an International Standard Content Code (ISCC) based checksum and similarity hash from a single file or collection of files.
The ISCC-SUM is a content-derived identifier that: - Creates a unique checksum based on file content - Generates a similarity hash for content comparison - Works with any file format
Input Options ============= 1. **Single File**: Calculate ISCC hash for one file <<<<<<< Updated upstream 2. **Collection of Files**: Calculate ISCC hash for multiple files in a collection
Processing Modes (Collection only) ==================================
When using a collection, you can choose:
1. **Individual Mode** (default): Calculates a separate ISCC hash for each file in the collection
- Output includes the element identifier and its corresponding ISCC hash - Useful for tracking individual files in a collection
2. **Combined Mode**: Calculates a single ISCC hash for all files together
- Concatenates all files in the collection and generates one unified ISCC hash - Useful for verifying integrity of file sets or detecting changes across multiple files ======= 2. **Collection of Files**: Calculate a single ISCC hash for multiple files in a collection >>>>>>> Stashed changes
Output ======
A text file containing: - Single file: Single ISCC-SUM code - Collection: Single ISCC-SUM code for all files in the collection
More Information ================
For more details about ISCC, visit: https://sum.iscc.codes/
